docs.abstract: Expansion of the amount and duration of safety-net measures for the unemployed has increased the number of people not working, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Expansion of the amount and duration of safety-net measures for the unemployed has increased the number of people not working, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals judge allowed Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women late Monday night, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so.

headline.main: Texas: Judge Stays Order on Health Care Program
headline.print_headline: Texas: Judge Stays Order On Health Care Program

docs.abstract: Federal appeals judge allows Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so; at issue is state rule requiring providers in the program to certify that they do not affiliate with entities that perform or promote abortions.
docs.snippet: A federal appeals judge allowed Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women late Monday night, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so.

docs.lead_paragraph: Starting next year, New York will become the first state to require unpaid work from lawyers seeking to practice here, a move intended to help people who cannot afford legal services.

headline.seo: New Lawyers in New York to Be Required to Do Some Work Free
headline.main: Top Judge Makes Free Legal Work Mandatory for Joining State Bar
headline.print_headline: Top Judge Makes Free Legal Work Mandatory for Joining State Bar

docs.abstract: New York will require lawyers to perform 50 hours of pro bono work before they are admitted to the New York State Bar, beginning in 2013; move is intended to help growing number of people who cannot afford legal services.
docs.snippet: Starting next year, New York will become the first state to require unpaid work from lawyers seeking to practice here, a move intended to help people who cannot afford legal services.

headline.main: Most Workers Lack Disability Insurance, Survey Finds

docs.abstract: Most workers aren't covered by disability insurance, a new survey finds.
docs.snippet: Most workers aren't covered by disability insurance, a new survey finds.

headline.main: Arrests and Clashes Downtown as May Day Protests Spread
headline.print_headline: At May Day Demonstrations, Traffic Jams and Arrests

docs.abstract: The protests, coordinated by Occupy Wall Street, grew more clamorous as the day wore on, and by late afternoon, there were a number of witness reports of arrests.
docs.snippet: The protests, coordinated by Occupy Wall Street, grew more clamorous as the day wore on, and by late afternoon, there were a number of witness reports of arrests.

byline.original: By COLIN MOYNIHAN, IVAN PEREIRA and ANDY NEWMAN

docs.abstract: Political news from today's Times and around the Web, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.
docs.snippet: Political news from today's Times and around the Web, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Austin prevented Texas from enforcing a rule that would have banned Planned Parenthood from participating in a health care program for low-income women.

headline.main: Texas: Judge Prevents Ban on Funds to Planned Parenthood
headline.print_headline: Texas: Judge Prevents Ban On Funds To Planned Parenthood

docs.abstract: Judge Lee Yeakel, a federal judge in Austin, Tex, issues decision that will prevent Texas from enforcing a rule that would have banned Planned Parenthood clinics statewide from participating in a health care program for low-income women.
docs.snippet: A federal judge in Austin prevented Texas from enforcing a rule that would have banned Planned Parenthood from participating in a health care program for low-income women.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Angel Taveras of Providence, R.I., said the only way the city could avoid bankruptcy was by scaling back pension benefits.

headline.main: Providence Mayor Moves Financial Woes to Fore
headline.print_headline: Providence Mayor Moves Financial Woes to Fore

docs.abstract: Providence City Council in Rhode Island signs off on a plan by Mayor Angel Taveras to end annual cost-of-living increases for about 3,000 retired police officers, firefighters and other employees getting city pensions; cuts are estimated to save the city about $16 million in the 2013 fiscal year and may help it stave off bankruptcy.
docs.snippet: Mayor Angel Taveras of Providence, R.I., said the only way the city could avoid bankruptcy was by scaling back pension benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health insurer pushed up its yearly forecast, but not enough to prevent a drop of 8.1 percent in the company’s shares.
docs.abstract: Humana Inc reports first-quarter profit of $248 million, or $1.49 a share, down 21 percent from $315 million, or $1.86 a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 11 percent to $10.2 billion.
docs.snippet: The health insurer pushed up its yearly forecast, but not enough to prevent a drop of 8.1 percent in the company’s shares.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor asks why Americans should subsidize the cost of these drugs for the entire world.
docs.snippet: A doctor asks why Americans should subsidize the cost of these drugs for the entire world.
